content: spiral soap sack pattern by liz alvino what is a soap sack soap sacks are small cotton pouches that are knit or crocheted with soft cotton yarn that are easy to wash they are a great thing to make and then fill with a bar of soap in its original packaging and donate to homeless shelters food pantries veteran clinics relief efforts and social service agencies i wrote this pattern with the mission of soapsacks com in mind their motto is supporting a community with kindness you can find lots of information and resources on their website https //www soapsacks com/ there are also tags on the website that you can print and attach to your soap sacks before you donate them i have also made a tutorial video so hop on over to youtube for additional help insert link https //youtu be/zysezbf3ynu 1 spiralsoapsackbylizalvino materials cotton yarn worsted weight you can make a few sacks with one skein 6mm/j or 6 5mm/k hook scissors tapestry needle a bar of soap in original packaging if you plan on donating them the size can be customized based on how big your bar of soap is but the finished size should be approximately 4x6 inches and have a loop or a drawstring this pattern is worked in an oval shaped spiral you can work the entire pattern in single_crochet half_double_crochet or double crochet you can also choose to do the stitches the regular way or in the back loop only soap sack pattern make a slip knot and place it on your hook -chain 10 this should be about 4 long if it s not adjust the amount of chains to make it 4 -work into the side of the chain for the first round by inserting your hook under 1 loop see picture below round 1 single_crochet in the 2nd chain from the hook and the next 7 stitches if you chained more than 10 there should be 1 stitch left 3 single_crochet in last chain see picture below 2 spiralsoapsackbylizalvino single_crochet in the next 7 chains or until you have 1 stitch left on the other side of the original chain row you will insert your hook under 2 loops where they cross on this side see arrow on right side of picture 2 single_crochet in the last stitch see picture below round 2 the entire pattern is worked in a spiral from now on so don t worry about joining stitches at the end of the round just keep working 1 stitch in each stitch around after the 2nd round you can choose to switch stitches if you want i enjoy doing half double crochet or double_crochet so it takes less time to make the soap sack but you can certainly stick with single_crochet for the whole thing there are samples of each stitch in the picture on page 1 it will start to cup after about the third row the right side should be facing you see picture
